AudioNode.summary: The AudioNode interface is a generic interface for representing an audio processing module.

blockquote.para: An AudioNode can be target of events, therefore it implements the interface.

AudioNodeConnect.summary:
The connect() method of the interface lets
you connect one of the node's outputs to a target, which may be either another
AudioNode (thereby directing the sound data to the specified node) or an
, so that the node's output data is automatically used to
change the value of that parameter over time.
AudioNodeConnect.returns:
If the destination is a node, connect() returns a reference to the
destination object, allowing you to chain multiple
connect() calls. In some browsers, older implementations of this interface
return .If the destination is an AudioParam, connect() returns
undefined.

AudioNodeDisconnect.summary: The disconnect() method of the interface lets you disconnect one or more nodes from the node on which the method is called.

AudioNodeContext.summary:
The read-only context property of the
interface returns the associated
, that is the object representing the processing graph
the node is participating in.
AudioNodeContext.value:
The or object that was
used to construct this AudioNode.

AudioNodeChannelInterpretation.summary: The channelInterpretation property of the interface represents an enumerated value describing how input channels are mapped to output channels when the number of inputs/outputs is different. For example, this setting defines how a mono input will be up-mixed to a stereo or 5.1 channel output, or how a quad channel input will be down-mixed to a stereo or mono output.

remarks.para: The property has two options: speakers and discrete. These are documented in Basic concepts behind Web Audio API > up-mixing and down-mixing.

AudioNodeChannelInterpretation.value: The values are documented in Basic concepts behind Web Audio API > up-mixing and down-mixing.In summary:

AudioNodeNumberOfOutputs.summary:
The numberOfOutputs property of
the interface returns the number of outputs coming out of
the node. Destination nodes — like — have
a value of 0 for this attribute.

AudioNodeNumberOfInputs.summary:
The numberOfInputs property of
the interface returns the number of inputs feeding the
node. Source nodes are defined as nodes having a numberOfInputs
property with a value of 0.

AudioNodeChannelCount.summary: The channelCount property of the interface represents an integer used to determine how many channels are used when up-mixing and down-mixing connections to any inputs to the node.

remarks.para: channelCount's usage and precise definition depend on the value of :

AudioNodeChannelCountMode.summary: The channelCountMode property of the interface represents an enumerated value describing the way channels must be matched between the node's inputs and outputs.
AudioNodeChannelCountMode.value:
The possible values of the channelCountMode enumerated value, and their meanings are:
NOTEIn older versions of the spec, the default for a was max.
